title: @Repertoir thoughts on Removing Yasuo's Armor Pen for other strengths?
body:
His Ult Armor Pen really has no place in his kit. People can't itemize against it, as well as he already builds items with Armor Pen, increasing it to ridiculous amounts.

It doesn't fit thematically in any way. Thoughts on removing it in order to allow power in other places in his kit?

replies.body:
Remove the armor pen from the ult
Remove the reduced critical strike damage on Q or reduce it to 10% from 25%

Yeah, not entirely sure. I'm sure a reasonable power shift/tradeoff could be made, and I also know a lot of players would like to see it go. Personally, it doesn't offend me all that much because I think a melee guy that doesn't get tanky or go untargetable has to be able to do damage to whatever he can manage to hit, but I do see the point of critics of the mechanic. It's mostly invisible, and it makes it feel like your itemization choices against him aren't meaningful.

One thing to keep in mind is that, if such a power shift were made, it would probably be in a way that felt worse to squishy characters, since the current mechanic has almost no impact on squishies, and replacing that with something else would make him feel more assassin-y. Maybe these squishy guys already feel like Yasuo is an assassin against them, so it would make no difference?

That's the thing, he kills squishies just as fast as if not faster than tanks, ult or no. It often feels like if you get hit by his ult, that's it, because he becomes ridiculously powerful after just two item buys (SS and IE)

IIRC the intended role for Yasuo was to stay in the backline, land a Q on the enemy frontline and be able to be a threat to them. Problem is, yasuo comes to the front, throws his Q all the way into the enemy backline and presses R to melt the squishies. Yasuo was not intended as an assassin and should have not be able to reach the enemy backline with his R, but he does. I think this makes it confusing as to what yasuo should be good at and what not. 
Want to stick with the "melt the tank" idendity? Work on his assassin-y engage. Want to keep his assasin identity? Give him weakness against tanks.

my 2 cents :)

I like the light fighter identity of Yasuo much more than the assassin. He is only an assassin because auto-attacks scale insanely well in LoL, even against squishies, and Yasuo can reach the backline with ult.
For the light fighter identity, Yasuo needs to be able to touch tanks and the penetration lets him, similarly to how Fiora deals true damage.

If I were to nerf Yasuo, I'd reduce the range on the ultimate. It's silly.

I am not an yasuo player, but can i drop this point of view?

When Yasuo was announced i got really hyped because it showed up to be playable like a true samurai: a fist of damage and dervish attacks while being a bit tanky.

I always imagined him to be the kind of dude with an assassin-like early lanes and then went full tank after reaching 100% crit to resist damage in the middle of a teamfight while dealing damage, a bit like fiora now: thanks to his ultimate he could afford to forgo damage and shred his targets and rewarded him for staying in combat.

I did not got him immediately because i was out of IP, then i saw how it became "yet an other assassin" and i got hyped down.

So, in short, to me the armor penetration on his ult is a really important piece of his kit and characterization but has so much front damage that is made less worthwile to stick to a target. 
Probably is fine lile it is now, probably i am thinking about something that will never be or that is already to be explored, but i would look at other parts of his kit to change.

If i recall right, Yasuo was intended as melee-carry, so a primary damagedealer that kinda fills the role off an adc(and with his kit he actually is able to go botlane instead of an adc), and with rather low range mobillity(if you have no setup for the ult) and beeing melee, he needs to get some tankiness to do something in teamfights, so so beeing able to deal with tanks seems needed for him as he usually can'tafford the itemslot for a LW.
Maybe 50% bonus is to much and a total pen would be better as it wouldn't mean building armor vs yasuo feels totally usless...

Anyway, i personally think Yasuo would be a more interesting and health champ if the crit was removed from him and therefor the nerfs to his shield get undone, maybe with a small ratio buff to his Q. This would translate to a less frustraiting powerspike({{item:3031}} +{{item:3087}} is quite overbearing on him), and he wouldn't fuction as an assasin by bursting down squishy befor they touch the gound with the Q+R+AA+Q combo anymore, relying more on sustained damage and his mobillity paired with his shield.

Another wierd thing is that he gets the pen after his ult, though he usually deals with tanks **till** he uses the ult, as usually the ult is his acces to the squishy backline.
this leads to the feel that his ult mostly prohibits getting armor on squishy to counter his burst.
If you face talon or Zed, you usually get an early seekers as mage, and a zhonya later on, and you feel good about it.
As adc, you often would want a GA, or even a randuins as it's the most efficient single-def item vs physical damge, and with an ad-midlaner, chances are that the enemie team is very ad-heavy.
Vs Yasuo, those defensive options feel bad as he gets the 50% pen whenever he finds an engage...

When Yasuo was really, **really** strong [not saying he is not now] that armor pen would have been one of the things I'd wanted to delete. It gives him a real good itemization advantage not having to build last whisper, and it snowballs him hard if fed because of that itemization advantage.

But I think it's intended he can afford extra durability late game; more so I think it has a good purpose of allowing not fed out of the wazzo Yasuo's to fight actively in fights and not be a scared little assassin looking for openings into the backline, which will be more how he works without the armor penetration. It encourages him to play a little more like a melee dps champ fighter champs rather than assassin is the intention of it; but does it actually work or merely overload his kit making fed Yasuo unstoppable..? (Yasuo's best case is still ulting carries...)

Yasuo can probably be more balanced without it, and it'll take the edge off his snowballing without it. But it'll cement him into only looking for openings to carries until he can afford LW, which is what he wants to do anyways though. So maybe it would serve well to move power elsewhere. And then it'll feel like Yasuo has a lot more counterplay than "use a burst champion to shut his laning phase down"
